title: Don Quixote
author: Miguel De Cervantes
brief: The story of the gentle knight and his servant Sancho Panza has entranced readers for centuries.

title: Pilgrim's Progress
author: John Bunyan
brief: The one with the Slough of Despond and Vanity Fair.

title: Gulliver's Travels
author: Jonathan Swift
brief: A wonderful satire that still works for all ages, despite the savagery of Swift's vision.

title: Tom Jones
author: Henry Fielding
brief: The adventures of a high-spirited orphan boy: an unbeatable plot and a lot of sex ending in a blissful marriage.

title: Clarissa
author: Samuel Richardson
brief: One of the longest novels in the English language, but unputdownable.

title: Tristram Shandy
author: Laurence Sterne
brief: One of the first bestsellers, dismissed by Dr Johnson as too fashionable for its own good.

title: Dangerous Liaisons
author: Pierre Choderlos De Laclos
brief: An epistolary novel and a handbook for seducers: foppish, French, and ferocious.

title: Emma
author: Jane Austen
brief: Near impossible choice between this and Pride and Prejudice. But Emma never fails to fascinate and annoy.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
brief: Inspired by spending too much time with Shelley and Byron.
